definition: saliva/sweat/a ferry crossing/a ford (river crossing)/abbr. for Tianjin 天津
to stick/to paste/to post (e.g. on a blog)/to keep close to/to fit snugly/to subsidize/allowance (e.g. money for food or housing)/sticker/classifier for sticking plaster: strip

sentences.english: Could you tell me what the maximun weight allowances?
sentences.chinese: 你能告诉我最高津贴是多少么？

sentences.english: Is the artist at the national level, enjoy State Council special benefit.
sentences.chinese: 系国家一级美术师，享受国务院特殊津贴。

sentences.english: The number of persons granted state allowances has been appraised every double-digital year since 2003.
sentences.chinese: 享受国家津贴的人数从2003年起逢双年评比一次。

sentences.english: He is a national important contribution expert and is granted a Special Allowance from the State Council.
sentences.chinese: 国家级有突出贡献专家，国务院特殊津贴获得者。

sentences.english: In 2005, he was approved to receive the State Council special allowance.
sentences.chinese: 2005年被批准享受国务院特殊津贴。

sentences.english: How?By taking aim at the government's entitlement programs.
sentences.chinese: 他们把目标瞄向了政府津贴项目。

sentences.english: They deducted the cost of the broken window from his allowance.
sentences.chinese: 他们从他的津贴中扣除损坏窗户的费用。

sentences.english: Enlisted recipients of the Medal of Honor are entitled to a supplemental uniform allowance.
sentences.chinese: 荣誉勋章获得者将有资格获得军人的津贴。

sentences.english: Furthermore, subsidies provide incentives only for investments in equipment.
sentences.chinese: 更有甚者，提供津贴仅是为鼓励增添设备的投资。
1993年起为享受政府特殊津贴专家。

sentences.english: More investment spending implies the use of more sophisticated equipment and machinery.
sentences.chinese: 更有甚者，提供津贴仅是为鼓励增添设备的投资。

sentences.english: Post allowance system (PAS) is an innovation method of distribution system in college and university.
sentences.chinese: 高校岗位津贴制度是高校分配制度的创新之举。

sentences.english: The small allowance helps cover the cost of subsistence, and a full time caretaker if needed.
sentences.chinese: 津贴数额虽小，但可支付生活费和全职护理员的工资。

sentences.english: She spent three years at college, scraping along on an allowance from her parents.
sentences.chinese: 她靠父母的津贴勉勉强强地在大学里度过了三年。

sentences.english: Around 1.4m workers are receiving the short-time allowance.
sentences.chinese: 近140万工人得到了短期津贴。

sentences.english: She spent three years at the liberal arts college, scraping along on an allowance from her parents.
sentences.chinese: 她靠父母的津贴勉勉强强地在文科大学里度过了三年。

definition: to give an extra subsidy, or bonus etc/bonus/perquisite
to be reimbursed for actual expenses
